DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy of local infiltration analgesia as compared to 48-hour interscalene block in treating pain after shoulder arthroplasty. The investigators hypothesize a reduced pain score and use of supplemental analgesic medication during the first three postoperative days using local infiltration analgesia.
DOC.brief_title: Pain Management After Shoulder Prosthesis: A Clinical Trial of Nerve Block and Local Infiltration
DOC.criteria: elective primary shoulder arthroplasty reverse or delta prosthesis recent fracture near the shoulder allergic to amidtype local analgesics operation not under general anaesthesia incompetent, pregnant, below 18 or above 90 years old severe chronic neurogenic pain or sensory disturbances in the shoulder
